bioghist.p: The Union Carbide Company was formed in 1898, to manufacture carbon products for electric arc street lights and electric furnaces and calcium carbide for acetylene lighting. In 1920, with the commercial production of ethylene, Union Carbide became a principal founder and major force in the petrochemical industry. In 2001 Union Carbide merged with Dow Chemical Company and now exists as a wholly owned subsidiary of Dow Chemical.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a corporate history of Union Carbide Corporation from the 1890s to the 1990s. This history was compiled (with the consent of the company) by the Carbide Retirees Corps, an organization of retired Union Carbide employees. The collection is made up of 17 sections, each related to a product group or program at Union Carbide. Histories were compiled from personal recollections and files, patents, published accounts, and company files and annual reports. Materials in the collection include the printed histories and supporting documentation, in the form of photocopied records and some original materials.
